temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 个人网站开张两周年纪念 - strnghrs - 博客园 in the user temberature at 2022-05-30T18:46:13
item.description:
in reference to:

Q：开张两年，最遗憾的是什么？A：吾道甚孤。    这个有两方面的意思，一个是在软件开发方面，现在随着网络应用的流行，有能力从事Windows原生软件开发的人会越来越少，愿意免费开发的就更少。我的一些软件本来有验证想法的意思，希望能起到抛砖引玉的作用，没想到引来的却是要钱的仿制品。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:15:27
item.description:
in reference to:

从这个角度来讲，仿生阅读也未必适用于所有文章。沈阳师范大学曾做过一项文本标注对中文阅读眼动的研究。研究显示，虽然添加高亮会指引和帮助参与者们更好地记忆重点内容、忽略干扰内容，但如果含有错误标识或标识过多，那与无标识的阅读效率几乎是一样的。同时，如果阅读的文本是比较简单的内容，那标示也未必可以提高正确率。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:16:51
item.description:
in reference to:

加粗分词后的第一个字确实有助于帮助断句、加快阅读。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 中医这件事 in the user temberature at 2022-06-25T14:13:01
item.description:
in reference to:

人类医学史上第一个真正意义上的对照临床试验。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 中医这件事 in the user temberature at 2022-06-25T14:17:45
item.description:
in reference to:

所以后来索性把医生的眼睛也蒙起来——不告诉医疗人员哪组是安慰剂组哪组是实验组，所有的结果由第三方机构去统计和评判，这就是双盲对照实验。这种测试最大限度地排除了病人的安慰剂效应和医生的主观偏好，成为了判断药物客观疗效最有力的证据，现代医学的“金标准”。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:22:29
item.description:
in reference to:

some of the reasons have nothing to do with choosing the “best learning tool,” but with regards to how my workflow and my life have changed.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:30:38
item.description:
in reference to:

With the benefit of hindsight, one glaring problem is that, what you do to increase the levels of processing (increasing comprehension and making connections) is beyond the scope of any spaced repetition systems; they’re not conducive to (deep) thinking and making connections.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:44:26
item.description:
in reference to:

From now on, my focus on “how to learn” would be shifted from “when should I review this” to “what should I do when I indeed review this?” It’ll be about thinking frameworks and mental models; it’s about “what and how to think” instead of “when to think.”

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.description:

Over time you will figure out your preferred motions and work flow. You will develop muscle memory for most of it and it will be intuitive (直观) and instinctive (本能) .

item.description:

Learning to use vim really is like learning a language. You're still "translating" in your head instead of just "speaking" naturally. Just keep practicing and it will become second nature with time.

item.description:
in reference to:

DEVONthink 在学术领域有着非常广阔的前景，不止可以用作 Archive 工具，也是是非常好的 research 工具。从学生的角度来看，将从 Portal 中下载下来的 PPT、PDF 等文件 Index 到 DEVONthink 中，使用 RTFD 记笔记，随后使用 See Also 从之前 Index 好的数据中检索相关信息；另外使用 DEVONthink Index Bookends 的 attachment folder，从而使用 Bookends 管理 citation、DEVONthink 做 research，都是非常吸引人的使用场景。这篇文章的 research 工作全部是在 DEVONthink 中完成的，当所有相关文件全部存入 DEVONthink 以后，搜索真是一件美好的事情。另外能够检索 Google Scholar 等数据库的 DEVONagent是无缝整合进 DEVONthink 中的，在只使用 DEVONthink 就获得了令我满意的体验情况下，我十分期待把 DEVONagent 融入工作流以后的表现。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 年度征文 | 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ - 少数派 in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T03:30:41
item.description:
in reference to:

对于 DEVONthink 来说，我觉得它最重要的就是 Search 搜索功能。比如说我通过 Alfred 的 DEVONthink 插件快速输入「重器轻用」，然后我就可以搜到在 DEVONthink 里面所有关于「重器轻用」的信息。而这个搜索速度是极快的，并且在右侧边栏，你可以看到搜索结果有一个展现的区域，让你快速知道哪些地方有相关文字的一个出处。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/devonthink - Is DEVONthink worth it? in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T04:02:11
item.description:
in reference to:

I suppose it depends what you want to use it for. I use it for research mainly. It is excellent for document storage and analysts and it has been a game changer for me. Coupled with its ability with RSS feeds and Devon agent, I have to say it is superb. I suspect I’m only scratching the surface of its capability. It is a pretty steep learning curve but it’s capabilities are massive.Have a look at the videos on www.screencastsonline.com there is a free membership for 7 days which should give you some idea of what it is capable of. They were a great intro for me.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How long does it take to master a language like a native speaker? in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T03:10:21
item.description:
in reference to:

I find that memorizing a number of ‘filler’ words or sentences can greatly increase your ability to come off as native, as well as knowing some expressions and sayings. Instead of expressing agreement with a simple ‘yes’ you could try responding with “you know what? I Agree!” or “I think I see what you mean”. It’s agreement either way but it sounds a lot more ‘native’.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Folder Structure to Maximize Writing with Devonthink Pro — Workflows in Personal and Professional Productivity in the user temberature at 2022-09-03T14:29:11
item.description:
in reference to:

Although at one point I had all my information on manuscripts in a single DTP database, over the last year I have maintained separate databases; one for PDFs, another for my annotations.I accomplish this by having separate folders in Dropbox. After extracting my annotations from Highlights.app, I place the exported files in their own folder. Once a month, I export all the PDFs in my Paper’s Library to their own Dropbox folder. I use a Hazel script to throw away any duplicate PDFs in the Dropbox folder. I index (not import) the annotations folder into one DTP database, and index my PDFs into another.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Security | Electron in the user temberature at 2022-09-14T12:56:21
item.description:
in reference to:

In fact, the most popular Electron apps (Atom, Slack, Visual Studio Code, etc) display primarily local content (or trusted, secure remote content without Node integration)

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Security | Electron in the user temberature at 2022-09-14T16:09:24
item.description:
in reference to:

Under no circumstances should you load and execute remote code with Node.js integration enabled. Instead, use only local files (packaged together with your application) to execute Node.js code. To display remote content, use the tag or BrowserView, make sure to disable the nodeIntegration and enable contextIsolation.

item.description:
in reference to:

蛋白质通常不用于供应能量。然而，如果人体未从其他营养物质或体内贮存的脂肪中获得足够热量，则会将蛋白质分解为酮体以供应能量。如果蛋白质的消耗量比需要量多，那么人体就会分解蛋白质，然后以脂肪的形式贮存起来。

item.description:
in reference to:

We want to create notes that are relevant to contexts important to us, not just related to the book we read.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How To Take Smart Notes –– Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T06:56:07
item.description:
in reference to:

A note is only as valuable as its context - its network of associations, relationships and connections to other information.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How To Take Smart Notes –– Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T06:57:04
item.description:
in reference to:

We want to file information in the context we want to rediscover it in, not the context that we found it in.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How To Take Smart Notes –– Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T07:00:56
item.description:
in reference to:

Useful learning is to connect a piece of information to as many meaningful contexts as possible, which is what we do when we connect our notes in the slip-box with other notes.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How to Take Smart Notes by Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T07:02:47
item.description:
in reference to:

What differentiates the Smart Notes method from other note-taking methods is it recognizes that a note is only as useful as the context it is embedded in – its network of associations, relationships, and connections to other ideas.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How to Take Smart Notes by Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T07:05:01
item.description:

item.description:
in reference to:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated UX Thought of the Day - Design + Development = Responsive Design - jeankap@gmail.com - Gmail in the user temberature at 2022-12-02T05:43:14

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Qt编程涉及的术语和名词 in the user temberature at 2022-12-12T16:19:37
item.description:
in reference to:

Debug 版本程序通常链接的也是 Debug 版本的库文件，比如 libQt5Guid.a/Qt5Guid.dll，库文件的简短名（不含扩展名）都是以 d 结尾的，Debug 库通常都比较大 。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Qt编程涉及的术语和名词 in the user temberature at 2022-12-12T16:20:43
item.description:
in reference to:

Linux/Unix 系统里静态库扩展名一般是 .a，动态库扩展名一般是 .so 。Windows 系统里 VC 编译器用的静态库扩展名一般是 .lib，动态库扩展名一般是 .dll 。

By default, in public repositories, any user can submit reviews that approve or request changes to a pull request. Organization owners and repository admins can limit who is able to give approving pull request reviews or request changes.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated OpenAI API in the user temberature at 2022-12-13T16:00:10
item.description:
in reference to:

There are two ways to limit the likelihood of the API making up an answer.Provide a ground truth for the API. If you provide the API with a body of text to answer questions about (like a Wikipedia entry) it will be less likely to confabulate a response.Use a low probability and show the API how to say "I don't know". If the API understands that in cases where it's less certain about a response that saying "I don't know" or some variation is appropriate, it will be less inclined to make up answers.
